'Joining the Kirov Ballet
Hello, I'm Nathalie. Last year, I joined the Kirov Ballet School in St Petersburg, Russia. I was one of the youngest foreign students there. At my first ballet class, I felt nervous because I didn't know anyone. The other students asked me questions in Russian. I tried to speak Russian, and then they spoke English, so we could talk. Now, after six months, everyone is nice to me. My Russian is much better, and I understand my teachers.
When I first arrived, my mum stayed with me for two weeks. I was a bit sad when she left. One night, I called her because I felt lonely. The ballet classes in Russia are harder than in England. I eat a lot to have energy for the classes. This helps me perform well. In the evenings, I watch my favorite films on my computer, but sometimes I fall asleep before the film ends.
Now, I feel at home here. I like walking in the city and visiting shops, even in December when it was very cold. It was minus 10Â°C, so I bought a fur hat. The Russians said it was not very cold for that time of year! My room is warm and cozy.
We are preparing for a new ballet show, and there is a competition for young dancers. I will join the competition. I feel very lucky to be here.'

**THE ICEHOTEL**
The Arctic is a place where the sun does not set in summer. Many people visit in summer, but in winter, it was mostly empty. In the late 1980s, people thought winter could be special too. In 1990, a French artist named Jannot Derit opened an art show in an igloo (a house made of snow) in Jukkasjarvi, a small town on the Torne River. This place was called Arctic Hall, and many people came to see it. One night, some visitors decided to sleep there. They liked it, and this gave the idea to make an ice hotel. Now, the ICEHOTEL is famous all over the world.
Every winter, builders, architects, and artists come to Jukkasjarvi to build the hotel. They start in December, and the hotel is ready by January 7th. The hotel is made of snow and ice, so it melts in spring when it gets warm. Inside the hotel, it is always between -5Â°C and -8Â°C, even if it is colder outside. Guests get warm clothes like overalls, hats, and gloves. It is also good to bring sweaters, a scarf, and thick socks. You can buy these on the ICEHOTEL website and they will be in your room when you arrive.
The ICEHOTEL is in Jukkasjarvi, 200 km north of the Arctic Circle. It is 15 km from Kiruna airport and 17 km from Kiruna train station. You can take a bus from the airport or train station to the hotel.

'Shopping for furniture A report by Dave Worthington Homestyle is a new furniture shop. It had to close soon after it opened at midnight last Thursday. About 6,000 people came to the shop. There were special offers, like a leather sofa for Â£45 until 3 am and a bed for Â£30 from 3 am to 8 am. The shop's normal hours are 9 am to 9 pm every day. But Homestyle said it would stay open for 24 hours on the first day. However, it closed after 30 minutes. A police officer said: 'We knew many people would come, but they were not patient. The shop was full, so the managers closed the doors. People outside got angry because they thought everything would sell out. They did not want to wait in line. Also, many cars were trying to get to the car park. Some people left their cars in the road and walked to the shop. This blocked the road.' One customer, Jenny Smith, got into the shop. She said: 'I waited for three hours but did not have time to buy anything. The staff were calm and explained the situation. It was not safe, so they had to close. I will come back when they open again, but I will not wait in line.'

The Short Story Society helps writers in Britain. It started in 1899 and is very active today. 
Magazines
The Society makes magazines like the Short Story Review. This magazine has stories by famous writers and new writers. Another magazine, Short Story News, has interviews and information about events and competitions. You can read some articles on the website.
National Short Story Competition
The Society has a big competition for short stories. Anyone 18 or older can join. Stories can be about anything and should be 1,000 to 1,500 words long. Members do not pay to enter, but non-members pay Â£5. The competition is from April to October. The best stories are in a special book, and the winner gets a chance to publish their own book.
Education
For almost 30 years, the Society has helped children and teachers with writing. They have a project called Young Writer of the Year for ages 11-18. Winners get book prizes and can join a special writing course.
The Writers' Cafe
The Writers' Cafe is a place to relax. It has vegetarian food, coffee, and drinks. You can read magazines there. The Cafe also has art shows, short courses, and readings. It is in London and open Monday to Friday from 11:00 am to 10:00 pm, and Saturday from 11:00 am to 8:00 pm. Members get discounts.
Becoming a Member
People from all over the world can join. You must be 18 or older. If you want to join, fill out a form on the website.

'Free-diving in the Caribbean Tanya Streeter is very good at free-diving. Free-diving is a sport where people dive deep into the ocean with just one breath. In 2003, Tanya Streeter became famous because she dived 120 meters deep and came back up without help. She held her breath for over three and a half minutes. This made her the first woman to break a man's world record in any sport. Fourteen safety divers watched her dive to make sure she was safe. Some people think free-diving is dangerous, but Tanya says it is safe if you train well and have good safety. Tanya trains a lot. She spends most of her time training in the gym. She also trains in the pool and the ocean. She uses an exercise bike to make her heart strong. She does not run because she wants to protect her knees. Instead, she walks fast to stay fit. When she practices diving, she goes away from home. She does fourteen dives in four weeks, with a rest day after each dive. Rest is important so she does not get too tired. When Tanya is not diving, she talks to people about sports and helps with environmental projects. She grew up on the Caribbean island of Grand Cayman and loved swimming and exploring the sea. Tanya says her life now is like her childhood dreams. She is famous in some countries, so people listen to her about the environment. Tanya is in her thirties and wants to keep breaking her own records. She started free-diving at twenty-five and plans to continue for many more years.'

CARTOON FILMS
Cartoon films can show anything. If you can draw it, you can make it move on the screen. New ideas and computer programs make cartoons fun for everyone again. In the 1970s, people thought cartoons were only for kids. But some directors had new ideas. They showed that both adults and kids could enjoy cartoons. Not all cartoon films were good. The Black Cauldron did not do well because it was too scary for kids and too simple for adults. Directors learned from this, and film companies started making a lot of money again.

Title: Caroline Benson's First TV Role
Caroline Benson is a new TV star. She talks about her first TV role. 
Caroline did not think she would film a TV show in her first year at university. She had only acted in school plays before. She loved the book "The Finnegans" since she was eleven. Her grandmother said she was like Polly Finnegan, a character in the book. Caroline always wanted to play Polly.
Before university, Caroline took a year off to travel. While in Chile, her mother emailed her. The email said there were plans to make the book into a TV show. Caroline wanted to try for the role. Her mother sent her photo to the director and asked him to meet Caroline. Caroline flew back and got the role.
Filming started a week after university began. Caroline got permission to be away for three weeks. When she returned to university, she woke up at 6:00 am to write essays. She did not tell her university friends about the TV show, but they found out and were happy for her.
Caroline says it was an amazing experience. She wants to be an actress after university. Her family is not in acting, but her grandfather was an opera singer. She tried for other TV roles but has not received any offers yet. Caroline had a busy social life too. When filming ended, she did not know what to do. She acted in two college plays after that.
Caroline has not been home much. Now her first year at university is over. She is going to Greece for the summer with friends.

'No Title When I opened the first 'Body Shop' in 1976, I just wanted to make enough money to take care of my children. Today, 'The Body Shop' is a big company growing all over the world. Since we started, I have learned many things. I share these lessons in this book because I think we have important ideas about running a business. This book is not a typical business book, and it is not just about my life. The main idea is that to do well in business, you need to be different. Business can be fun, it can be run with love, and it can help people. In business and in life, I want to have fun, feel like a family, and enjoy surprises. I want the people who work for 'The Body Shop' to feel the same way. This book shares my ideas with everyone. I believe there are no limits to our 'family' and what we can do. I find this very exciting, and I hope you do, too.'

Title: A Trip on the Douro River
Jules Verne offers a trip on a 'hotel ship' on the Douro River in Portugal. The ship, MV Lady Ivy May, can have 160 guests. Each room has a private shower and toilet. The ship has air-conditioning, a sun deck, lounge, bar, dining room, shop, and library.
Day 1: You leave London Heathrow in the evening and fly to Oporto. A guide will meet you and take you to the Lady Ivy May to sleep.
Day 2: In the morning, you will see Oporto. Then, you go back to the ship and travel to Entre-os-Rios. This takes four hours.
Day 3: You keep going up the river. In the evening, the ship stops at Peso da Regua, where they make port wine. You can try the food and drink at dinner.
Day 4: After breakfast, you take a bus to Lamego. You will see the cathedral, some churches, and a museum. The museum used to be a palace and has paintings, tapestries, and sculptures. Then, you go back to the ship and sail to Tua.
Day 5: The river gets narrow here. If the river is deep enough, you might take a smaller boat to Barca d'Alva, near Spain. You return to Tua by bus and see many things on the way.
Day 6: In the morning, you drive to Sao Joao da Pesqueira for a great view of the Douro valley. You return to the ship for lunch. Then, you take a train ride through the countryside to Regua, where the ship waits for you.
Day 7: You visit Vila Real, then return to the ship for lunch. You travel back down the river to Oporto and sleep on the ship.
Day 8: You arrive in Oporto. You have time to see the city and shop before flying back to London Heathrow.

HONEY
Honey is a sweet liquid made by bees. It has water and sugars. Bees travel very far and visit many flowers to make honey. They can travel 75,000 kilometers and visit over two million flowers to make just half a kilo of honey. The color and taste of honey depend on the flowers. There are more than 300 types of honey. Light-colored honey is usually milder in taste than dark honey. 
A long time ago, honey was the main sweet food because sugar was hard to find. The ancient Egyptians thought honey was very valuable and used it as money. Today, people make and eat honey all over the world. Research says honey can help with tiredness and make athletes perform better. Honey is not just food; it can help with sore throats and is used in many skin and hair-care products.

Norwich is a city in East Anglia, a part of Britain. People have lived there for more than 2,000 years. It started as a small village by the River Wensum. By 1066, it was one of the biggest towns in England. Norwich has two cathedrals and a mosque, making it important for different religions. The first cathedral was built in 1095. In 1994, Norwich celebrated 800 years since it became a city with a Royal Charter, which means it could govern itself.
Today, Norwich is smaller than London or Manchester, with about 150,000 people. In the 16th century, it was the second biggest city in England. It grew for 300 years and became rich, known for having many churches and pubs. Now, there are fewer churches and pubs, but in 1964, the University of East Anglia was built there. Norwich has many things to do, like theatres, cinemas, nightclubs, cafes, restaurants, and arts centers. It also has a football team called 'The Canaries', with green and yellow colors.
Norwich has a modern shopping center called 'The Castle Mall'. Builders made a big hole in the city for over two years to build it. They moved a lot of earth to make a park on the roof with water pools and trees. People in Norwich are happy that the old market is still there, next to the new shopping center. Both places are busy, showing that Norwich has a good mix of old and new things.

**The Albuquerque Balloon Festival**
Every autumn, the sky in Albuquerque, a city in the southwestern United States, is full of bright colors. This is because of the Albuquerque Balloon Festival. It is a big event that lasts nine days every year. The first festival was in 1972 to celebrate a local radio station's 50th birthday. Back then, there were only about twelve hot-air balloons, and they took off from a parking lot in the city. Now, the festival is much bigger. This year, about a thousand balloons from many countries will come to the festival.
**What to See**
The balloon pilots talk to each other using radios. They light up their balloons at the same time. This is called a 'balloon glow.' It is a great time to take photos. You need to come just after it gets dark or before 5:30 am to see the balloons glow in the dark sky. During the day, you can walk around and talk to the pilots as they get ready to fly. The balloons are different sizes and colors. Some look like animals, cartoon characters, or famous products like soft drinks and fast food. Kids will really enjoy it.
In the afternoon, you can go on a balloon ride over the desert. Many companies offer these rides. You can also take a cable car ride to the top of the nearby mountains. This is the longest cable car ride in the world, and you can see the festival from high up. There are many other fun things to do, like watching balloon races and fireworks on the first night and the last three nights of the festival.
**The Albuquerque Box**
This is a special wind pattern that is great for flying balloons. The Sandia Mountains keep the balloons safe from strong winds. The mountains also make gentle winds at different heights. This helps skilled pilots control where their balloons go.
**Practical Advice**
Buy your tickets online before you go to the festival. This will save you time. Wear layers of clothes because it can be cold at night and in the morning, but you will need sunglasses and sunscreen during the day. Bring a flashlight for night events and a camera for pictures. If you use a film camera, bring high-speed film for night photos.

The Eden Project
The Eden Project is in the south-west of England. It is a very popular place for tourists to visit in the UK. When you see it, the big 'biospheres' look like something from a science-fiction movie. Each biosphere has a different climate. This shows how important plants are to people. Many things we use every day come from plants, like wood, rubber, fruit, rice, sugar, coffee, and chocolate. There are over 135,000 different types of plants here. Even if it is cold outside, electric heaters keep the plants warm. In the Rainforest Zone, it is always wet because of a big waterfall. Another zone is like the weather in the Mediterranean, California, and South Africa. They also plan to make a desert zone soon.

'No Title Some people do not like this year's book, New Writing 3, but I do not know why. The book has 500 pages of new writing for only Â£6.99, which is great! Most of the book is stories. There are parts of novels and short stories. Famous writers like Candia McWilliam and Rose Tremain have written some fun stories. Some writers who are not very famous write a lot about food. Be careful with Jane Harris's story, Those Nails. Do not read it after eating because it has some scenes that might make you feel sick! There are also poems by nineteen poets, like R. S. Thomas and John Burnside. You can read parts of new novels by Jim Crace and Jane Rogers. There is a little non-fiction too. Alan Rusbridger wrote a funny article about newspapers, and Ursula Owen wrote an interesting piece about herself. This is a great book, and I am excited to see what next year's book will have.'

'Learning the Violin'
"The best age to start learning the violin is between three and six," says Margaret Porter, a violinist and music teacher. "This is when you are learning about the world." Margaret lives in London and likes to teach children who are three or four years old. But she also teaches some five-year-olds who really want to learn.
Margaret started teaching the violin in 1972. Her first class was with her children's five-year-old friends. Margaret's students have group lessons. Each group has about twelve students, and each lesson is one hour long, every two weeks. Each student also has one lesson alone with her every week. Parents must come to the classes too. It is important for parents to be interested in the lessons.
At first, students learn to play by listening. They do not read music until they have been playing for a few years. For a long time, there is a big difference between how they play and how they read music. Margaret says her way of teaching is not to make great violinists. She suggests that students who do very well should leave and learn the violin in a more traditional way.

'Moonshine The band Moonshine released their third CD last week. The new CD is called 'Here Again'. It comes after their last CD, 'The Waves'. There are some changes in the band. Tom Wilcott is now playing bass guitar. He replaced Simon McVee, who left the band last year. Tom Simpson is the new drummer. The first song on the CD is a dance song. This shows the band is not only making slow songs now. The second song is also a dance song and is even louder. Most of the other songs are slow, like their usual style. These two dance songs might surprise many fans. They are very good and could become popular. The singer, Rob Letchford, sings very well on this CD. He recorded the songs before he had problems with his throat. Because of this, the band had to cancel their next tour. People who bought tickets do not need to worry. The concerts will happen later when Rob is better. On this CD, Moonshine shows they can make great music in different styles. Some songs are slow, and some are fast. I think the best songs are at the beginning of the CD. The last songs are not as good. Even so, 'Here Again' will be a big success for the band.

San Francisco
San Francisco is a city on the coast of northern California. The first Europeans to find the area were led by a Spanish explorer named Gaspar de Portola. He saw it for the first time in 1769. San Francisco Bay is a great natural harbor, but it was found by people traveling on land, not by sea. 
In 1849, many people came to San Francisco to look for gold. But the people who got rich were not the ones looking for gold. The richest people made money by owning banks and law firms. They built big houses on a hill called Nob Hill.
Today, tourists visit San Francisco to see famous places like Chinatown and the Golden Gate Bridge. Many also take a short boat trip to Alcatraz Island to see the old prison.

'SAMUEL PEPYS Samuel Pepys wrote a very famous diary in English. It talks about life in England from 1660 to 1669. Pepys writes about big news, like sickness, enemy ships on the River Thames, and the Great Fire of London. He also writes about himself, like when he slept in church or looked at pretty girls. He talks about his life at home, like fighting with his wife and making up, and worrying about her when she was sick. Pepys liked books, music, the theatre, card games, and fun parties with good food. He was a busy man with important jobs. He was a Member of Parliament and President of the Royal Society. He is also known for his work with the British Navy.'

'The History of Shoes In the past, shoes were not made to be comfortable or stylish. Early shoes were probably made from animal skins. People tied them around their ankles when it was cold. We still use leather today, but we also use other materials like silk, plastic, or cotton. It depends on what is popular. About one hundred and fifty years ago, people started wearing different shoes on each foot. Before that, both shoes were the same and could be worn on either foot. All shoes used to be made by hand. Now, most shoes are made by machines in big factories. Sewing machines helped make many shoes quickly and cheaply for more people.'

'No Title When I hurt my back, I had to stop running for a while. I wanted to help more women try running. I wanted to show them it is fun and help them feel brave to start running. I started a running club for women in my area. I was upset because many race organizers complained there were not enough women in races. But they also did not give women their own changing rooms. I made posters, and 40 women joined the club. They were young and old, fit and not fit. They wanted to lose weight, but they did not think much about running before. They thought running was hard and painful. They did not think about running and talking with friends in nice places, like near a river. At first, they ran for only one minute. Now, they can run for thirty minutes. They also learned about healthy eating and staying fit from other runners. I wanted to help women run, and I am very happy to see them get better. They are happy too.'

**The History of the Iditarod - The Last Great Race on Earth**
In the 1880s, people found gold in Alaska, the most northern state in the USA. Many people went there to find gold and get rich. New towns were built quickly. One town was called Iditarod, which means 'far, distant place'. In 1909, Iditarod grew very fast and became the biggest city in Alaska for a short time.
In summer, boats could bring important things to these towns. But in winter, the rivers and ocean froze, so boats could not come. In 1910, a winter path was made for dogs to pull sleds. The dogs carried mail, food, and clothes to the gold miners. This path was called the Iditarod Trail. It took about three weeks for the dogs to travel across Alaska. They stopped at places called 'roadhouses' to rest and eat.
The trail was used every winter until the 1920s. Then, airplanes started to be used instead of dog teams. But in 1925, a disease called diphtheria was in the city of Nome. The medicine to cure it was far away in Anchorage. Airplanes were new, and people were not sure if they could fly in the cold. The best pilot was not there, so they used dog teams to bring the medicine.
The trip was over 1,000 kilometers, mostly on the Iditarod Trail. It took twenty dog teams six days to finish the trip. Leonhard Seppala, a man from Norway, traveled the first 400 kilometers. He trusted his dog Togo to find the way in the snow. The last part was done by Gunnar Kaasen, who had worked with dog teams for 21 years. His lead dog was Balto. Balto saved the team from falling into icy water. The diphtheria was stopped, and Balto became a hero.
Today, there is a dog sled race every year from Anchorage to Nome. It follows the same path as the 1925 journey. This race is called the Iditarod and is known as 'The Last Great Race on Earth'.

'Sweden's Ice Hotel The village of Jukkasjarvi is in Swedish Lapland. In winter, it can be very cold, as cold as -40Â°C. But 6,000 people visit every year to see a special hotel. This hotel is made of ice. You can eat, drink, and sleep in rooms made of ice. You can even get married there. The bar is also made of ice, so you should not put hot drinks on it! The bedrooms are about -4Â°C, but guests get special sleeping bags to stay warm. You can also get warm clothes if you need them. The hotel melts in summer, so it is rebuilt every winter. Building the hotel needs 10,000 tonnes of ice and 30,000 tonnes of snow.'

Maria Mutola
In 1988, Maria Mutola was the only girl playing football on a boys' team in Mozambique. "We won," she said. "At first, no one cared that I was a girl. But then the team we beat complained." A local newspaper wrote about her, and a man named Jose Craveirinha read it. He helped other African athletes and wanted to meet Maria. He saw her playing football and noticed she was very fast. 
Jose talked to Maria about running, but she only knew about football. He bought her running shoes and took her to train. It was hard work, and her legs hurt. Jose talked to her parents and said Maria could be successful and help the family. They agreed to let her train with him.
In 1991, Maria went to the United States to train. She didn't want to go before because she would miss her family. In the US, she met other girls who were different from her. They were good at sports, but they worried about clothes and make-up. Maria worried about her family having enough food. The trainers in the US were very good, and Maria learned a lot.
Today, Maria still runs. She lives in South Africa with her mother for most of the year.

The Skywalk
The Grand Canyon is in the United States. The River Colorado made the Grand Canyon. People go to the Grand Canyon Park to walk, run, and see the view. The view is very beautiful, and the Skywalk makes it even better. 
The Skywalk is 1219 meters above the bottom of the Grand Canyon. It is a platform made of glass. You can see the rocks below through the glass. Up to 120 people can stand on the Skywalk at the same time. It opened in 2007. Since then, many people have visited it. 
You must wear special covers on your shoes to keep the glass clean. Walking on the Skywalk feels like you are a bird flying high in the sky.

'THE ROCKIES The Rocky Mountains are a long group of mountains in North America. They start in the northwest and go down to the center in the south. The Rockies are smaller than the Alps, but they are still very beautiful. There are many roads in the Rockies, but the best way to see them is by train. You start in Vancouver, a very nice city in Canada. Vancouver is close to the water and the mountains. People can ski just 15 minutes by car from the city center. Before, 30 trains left Vancouver every day to go across the country. Now, only three trains go each week, but the trip is still very exciting. You can sleep on the train, which is fun, but you will miss some of the beautiful views at night.'

'ZOOS People started keeping animals in zoos over 3,000 years ago. The rulers of China had a big zoo called the Gardens of Intelligence. In the past, animals in zoos did tricks for visitors. Now, animals in zoos act naturally. Today, most cities have a zoo or wildlife park. Some people like zoos because they help us learn about animals and see them up close. But some people do not like zoos. They think it is wrong to keep animals in cages. They also say that in some zoos, animals live in dirty places and do not get good food.'

**Jazz**  
By Katie Atkins, age 14
I play the trumpet in my school jazz band. Last month, we had a jazz competition with other high schools, and our band won! Each band wore different clothes. My band wore black school uniforms, and others wore bright T-shirts. We didn't look like adult bands, but we played very well. Everyone was young, but the music was great. Some players even made new music on stage. It was fun to watch, and I loved playing on stage with my band!
Our school has a great jazz band, but not everyone can join. Only about half of the people who want to play get in. But anyone who wants to play can come to practice before school. We also spend time after school listening to jazz and learning about it. We go to jazz summer camps too. I have been to a few and learned a lot.
Adults are often surprised that young people like jazz. My music teacher says pop music is not hard enough for people who are serious about music. I like jazz because it is new and old at the same time. You can make your own music and feel like you are part of jazz history. 
My school is lucky because we have great teachers and parents who help us. Without them, we couldn't do well with our music!

'Watering the Desert In Marrakesh, Morocco, it can rain between November and March. It does not rain often, and when it rains a lot, the water pipes in the city cannot handle it. The streets become like rivers. But because many winters are dry, people are happy when it rains. Marrakesh has parks and gardens, not because of the rain, but because of underground channels. These channels were made in the 11th century and bring water from the mountains all year. Dry places that get water like this are called oases. South of Marrakesh is a place called Skoura. Here, people use water channels to make small squares of land to grow food. The Atlas mountains, covered in snow in winter, are a beautiful background.'

Gareth Ellis is 13 years old. He is the youngest son of Alan and Kath. Alan is an engineer, and Kath is a nursery teacher. Gareth has older brothers who work in banking and computers. But Gareth wants to be a clown. 
Three years ago, Alan lost his job. Alan, Kath, and Gareth decided to join the circus. They got jobs with a famous circus, and Gareth started learning to be a clown. He calls himself Bippo. They travel with the circus in the summer and go home in the winter. Gareth's brothers take care of the house when they are away.
Kath says it was not easy. They had to think and plan a lot. They only had a car and a small caravan to sleep in. They left their nice house. Gareth only missed his long, hot baths.
Gareth says people ask about his school. But he always has a teacher wherever they go. He uses the same books as his school friends and has a computer. He is not behind in his studies.
Kath says it was a hard choice, but it was the only way for Gareth to learn to be a clown. They are happy and enjoy it. Gareth says he wants to be the main clown in a circus one day, maybe in Bippo's circus.

Eight-eighteen News
Eight-eighteen News is a news group for young people. Our members are between 8 and 18 years old. We collect news and write reports, stories, and articles. We send these to big newspapers, magazines, TV, radio, and websites. You can read or listen to our news on the Eight-eighteen website.
We have three places in the country where young people can meet and work on projects. We want to open more places soon. Our news group started in 1994 and was called 'Young News'. More than 2,500 young people have been members.
Sophie was a member. She says: 'I first heard about Eight-eighteen when they talked to me for an article about hip hop music. I was surprised by the chances they had. Age did not matter, and they could do stories by themselves. I went to the Eight-eighteen center in my city, got training, and stayed until I was 18. Eight-eighteen helped me a lot. With the skills I learned, I got a job at 19. Now, I work at a big news website, checking articles before they go online.'
Join Eight-eighteen
When you join Eight-eighteen, you get training. You also go to meetings every month to decide who will write each news story. Members share skills with each other. 'Peer trainers' are members who are 12 years old or older. They teach new members basic journalism skills. Some trainers also teach outside Eight-eighteen, in youth clubs and summer camps. Older staff help them on these trips.
Eight-eighteen News has training for new members three times a year. The next training is in February. If you want to join, call Director Den Ley at 01622 657874 for more information. The Eight-eighteen program is good for children with all levels of reading and writing skills. Joining is free, and there is no test.

**Antarctica Sightseeing Flights**
**Welcome!** Here is what you need to know before booking a flight.
**About the Flight:**
- We fly from Sydney, Australia, to Antarctica and back in a big plane (Boeing 747).
- The flight is 12 hours long.
- We see ice and icebergs after about four hours.
- We spend four hours over Antarctica.
- Experts on the plane talk about Antarctica and answer questions.
- You can see what the pilot sees through a camera.
**Seats:**
- You get two boarding passes.
- You change seats halfway through the flight.
- Business and first class: window seat for half the flight.
- Economy: window or next-to-window seat for half the flight.
- You can walk around the plane to see better.
**Weather:**
- We have 17 flight plans.
- The captain chooses the best route for clear views.
**Wildlife:**
- We cannot see penguins or other animals well because they are far below.
- We do not land in Antarctica.
**Photos:**
- You can take photos.
- We have fun photo opportunities with Antarctic clothes.

'Little Chefs
Every Saturday, a group of children aged ten to fifteen learn how to cook. The cooking classes are very popular, and 30 children are waiting to join. Parents pay Â£280 for the course. Children have fun and learn to make good food. 
Bill, who is ten years old, says, 'I love my mum's cooking, and now I can cook better than her. The teachers make us laugh, especially when we eat the food we made together.'
Flora, who is twelve, has some trouble with onions. She says, 'I love cooking. I cooked a meal for ten friends, and they liked it. My mum said I should find a hobby instead of doing nothing on weekends. I liked staying at home, so I wasn't sure at first. But now, I'm happy I came.'
Their teacher, Philippe, says, 'It's great fun. Children listen and remember better than adults, but the kitchen is not always tidy when they cook! Adults always learn more about food. If parents teach their children to cook when they are young, they can make food for themselves when they grow up and leave home.''

'Winter Driving Winter can be dangerous because it is hard to know what will happen, and accidents can happen easily. Fog can be at the top of a hill. Ice can be under the melting snow and can make you go off the road. The car coming towards you might slide across the road. Rule Number One for driving on icy roads is to drive smoothly. Quick movements can make the car hard to control. So when you turn the wheel, touch the brakes, or go faster, do it gently and slowly. Imagine you have a full cup of hot coffee next to you. Drive so you do not spill it. Rule Number Two is to watch what might happen. The more ice there is, the further you need to look down the road. Test how long it takes to stop by gently braking. Remember, you might be driving faster than you think. In general, allow double your normal stopping distance when the road is wet, three times this distance on snow, and even more on ice. Try to stay in control of your car at all times to avoid trouble.'

Craigie Aitchison was a painter from Scotland. He went to London to study law but decided to go to art school instead. He found drawing classes hard but kept painting. In his late twenties, he got money from the Italian government to study art. He liked early Italian artists, and this shows in his work. He loved the green and brown colors of the Italian fields and the clear light there. He wanted to show this light in his paintings. He painted colors in thin layers, from light to dark, but he says he never knows how it will look in the end. He says, 'It's a secret - because I don't know myself.' Aitchison makes it sound easy. 'Anyone can use colors - you can buy them. I just notice what colors go next to each other.' He does not draw before painting because he thinks he might get bored and not finish the painting. He changes his paintings many times before they are done. He likes models who do not ask to see their pictures while he is painting them. 'If they want to look at the painting, I can't do it.' Since moving to London, he does not feel part of the Scottish painting scene. He says he just paints the way he can. His work still influences young British painters.

'Rock Band Two years ago, our 14-year-old son, Ben, asked us for drums for his birthday. At first, we said no because of the noise. Ben said, 'It's better than watching TV or playing computer games, and it will keep me out of trouble.' In the end, we agreed. 'Okay,' we said, 'but you must think about the family and the neighbors when you play.' That was just the start. Because drums are hard to move, Ben's band friends came to our house with their guitars and other equipment. So, for a few hours each week, the house is loud with their music and singing. At least Ben's hobby is good for our health: when the band plays, my husband and I go for a long walk. I must say, even if their music sounds strange, they are nice and polite boys. I can't say if they are good at music - my parents didn't like my music when I was young - but they play in local clubs for young people. We worry they won't do enough school work because of the band, but this hasn't happened yet. I always tell Ben how important school is. But one thing is sure - Ben was right: it keeps him out of trouble and he is never bored.'

'Atlantic College Last week I visited Atlantic College, a great private school in Wales. This school is special because it helps young people learn about life outside the classroom and study for their exams. The students are 16 to 18 years old and come from all over the world. In the morning, they study. In the afternoon, they do helpful activities like working on a farm, helping people with learning difficulties, or checking rivers for pollution. Students at Atlantic College come from different countries and backgrounds. Not many can pay the PS20,000 fees for two years, so there are grants to help. A quarter of the students are from Britain, and many get help from the government to attend. "I really like the college for helping young people understand each other," said Barbara Molenkamp, a student from the Netherlands. "You learn to live with and respect people, even if you don't like them. During the summer holidays, my mother saw that I argued less with my sister." In short, Atlantic College gives students a great education with methods that work well.'

'Being an older student I am 32 years old and just finished my first year at university. I go to classes, read books quickly, and write long essays. I decided to go to university after 14 years away from school. I was a secretary and made good money, but I was bored because I did not have to think much. I felt sad because I thought I would stay in that job forever. I saw students at the local university who looked happy and full of hope. I wanted to be like them. Now, as a student, it is hard to make friends with younger students. They think I am a teacher and ask me questions I cannot answer. I also feel different from the teachers because they know more than me, even though we are the same age. But I am happy to study because I need a qualification to get a good job. I like reading books on the weekend more than going to parties. I also enjoy student benefits like long holidays and discounts at the theatre and cinema. Sometimes I worry about what I will do after university, but I hope going back to school was a good choice.'

Henry Ford
Henry Ford was born on a farm in Michigan in 1863. He did not like farming. When he was fifteen, he started working as a mechanic. In 1893, he made his first car. After driving it 1,500 kilometers, he sold it and made two bigger cars. In 1903, he started the Ford Motor Company. He used strong but light steel to make cheap cars for people to buy. In 1908, he made the first Ford Model 'T', which cost $825. He soon sold 100 cars every day. By 1927, the Ford Motor Company was worth $700 million. Early Ford cars were simple and cheap, but there was not much choice. Henry Ford said about the Model T, 'You can have any color you like, as long as it's black.'

'Dear Sir, I saw your ad for English courses in the newspaper. I want more information. How much does a course cost? How long is each course? When does the next course start? Yours, Maria Gonzalez Dear Ms. Gonzalez, Thank you for your letter. Our next course starts in three weeks, on Monday, 9 May. This course is 6 weeks long and costs Â£150. If you want to start in June, we have another course. It is 10 weeks long and costs Â£200. I hope this helps. Yours, David May '

Rebecca Stevens was the first woman to climb Mount Everest. Before climbing the highest mountain in the world, she was a journalist and lived in a small apartment in south London. In 1993, Rebecca left her job and family to go to Asia with other climbers. Life on Everest was hard. "You must carry everything on your back," she said. "You can only take what you need. You can't wash on the mountain, and I didn't even take a toothbrush. I like to be clean, but there is no water, only snow. Water is heavy, so you only take enough to drink!" When Rebecca reached the top of Mount Everest on May 17, 1993, it was the best moment of her life. She became famous. Now, she has written a book about the trip, and people often ask her to talk about it. She has a new job on a science TV show. Rebecca is well known today and has more money, but she still lives in the small apartment in south London with her pictures and books about mountains!

Dear Mike, I am sorry you could not come to my party yesterday. Jon told me you had a bad cold and you stayed in bed. Are you feeling better now? The party was very good; the best I have ever had! Many of my friends were there and they gave me nice presents. I will tell you more about the party when you come to school on Monday. Love, Lorenzo

CANADA GEESE
Canada Geese are big birds with blue and white colors. When autumn comes, they need to fly south to a warmer place. It is too cold in Canada during winter, and the birds can die if they stay.
Last spring, a man named Bill Lishman found sixteen young Canada Geese on his farm. They lost their parents. Bill thought, "These young birds won't know what to do in autumn." Bill had a small airplane, and he decided to teach the birds to follow him. All summer, he took short trips in his plane, and the young geese flew after him.
When it got cold in autumn, Bill flew to Virginia in the United States. It is 600 miles south of his home in Canada. The geese followed him all the way. Bill left the geese in Virginia and went back home.
This spring, Bill waited for the birds to come back. They did not come, so Bill flew to Virginia to find them. He looked for two weeks but could not find them. When he got back home, Bill saw the geese waiting for him. They found their way home without him!

'ESTHER'S STORY When Esther finished school at sixteen, her aunt Flory gave her PS500 for her birthday. Most of Esther's friends went to college, but Esther used the money to start a business. She bought fruit, sugar, and jars to make jam. She sold the jam for PS1 a jar to her friends and soon made PS1000. At first, her parents wanted her to study and become a teacher or a doctor. But Esther kept making jam. After a few months, she sold it at the local market. Then she made orange juice and sold it to a school. After two years, her business grew big, and her parents were happy. She made many kinds of food for shops and supermarkets. She was so busy that she needed people to help her.'

'Dear Jacqueline, Do you want to go to the cinema with me after school today? We can watch Pocahontas at the ABC cinema. The movie starts at 6 o'clock. Shall we meet outside the cinema? Love, Isabella Dear Isabella, I am sorry, but I can't go to the cinema tonight. My mom has work, and I need to cook dinner. Maybe you can ask Karen to go with you? I hope you enjoy the movie. You can tell me about it tomorrow. Love, Jacqueline '

Corryvale Farm is in the west of England. Stephen and Jenny Blackler have cows and chickens. They sell milk and eggs. But most of their money comes from Jenny's sheep. She has 50 sheep. Each sheep has enough wool for six sweaters. Every six months, Stephen cuts the wool off the sheep so they do not get too hot. 
Five years ago, Jenny made some sweaters with the wool. She tried to sell them at markets. But it was summer and too hot, so people did not want sweaters. Then, she made socks. Everyone liked the socks because they were cheap, strong, and easy to wash. This is how Jenny's business started. 
At first, Jenny made the socks at home. But soon, she had many customers. She had to send the wool to a factory. Now, machines make all the socks. There are six colors, five sizes for all ages, and different socks for walking, sports, and skiing. Jenny is busiest at Christmas because Corryvale socks are a favorite gift. In Jenny's office, there are many letters from happy customers from all over the world.

'28 Long Road Brighton 22nd March Dear Pat, I came here three weeks ago. I am studying at a language school in Brighton. The students are from many different countries, and I have made many new friends. We have classes for five hours every day. I like our teacher a lot. His name is John, and he helps me if I make a mistake. I want to visit London next weekend because I am going back to my country on Monday. Can I see you there? Please write to me soon. Best wishes, Maria'

'BURGLARS LIKE THE AFTERNOON Most house break-ins happen between 2 p.m. and 6 p.m., say the police. Inspector Ian Saunders told our newspaper that house break-ins have increased by more than 30% compared to last year. He also said that 67% of break-ins happen when people leave a door or window open. Night-time break-ins are rare because families are usually at home. But winter afternoons are good for burglars because it is dark, and they can't be seen easily. Many houses are empty then because people are still at work. Inspector Saunders said it is a good idea to leave lights on in living rooms and bedrooms when you go on holiday. This can help keep burglars away. He also asked neighbors to watch other houses in the street when people are not at home. They should call the police if they see anything strange. 'We will also tell you how to make your house safe,' Inspector Saunders said. 'This help is free.''

Dear Lynne and Tony,
Thank you for letting me stay in your nice home for two nights. It was good to see you again. Here are the photos of your children that you wanted. They are nice photos, right? I hope you like them. I really like my new camera.
Next week, I will visit my sister in New York. I will take many photos there, too. I have not seen my sister for a long time.
Thanks again.
Love,  
Roy

'The History of Farming Before people started farming, they went to the forest to find plants or fruit to eat. This meant people moved all the time to find food. But about 12,000 years ago, in the Middle East, people started to grow food. These people were the first farmers. Farming let people stay in one place, and their villages got bigger. Some people in the villages could do other work, like making clothes, because farmers grew food for everyone. But farming was hard when the weather was bad, and some people did not have enough food. Today, farmers can grow more food, and it travels very far to our homes.'

Nicola Peet finished school at eighteen. She went to college and then worked at a small airport. After nine months, she started working for Saudi Arabian Airlines. Later, she joined British Airways as an air hostess. Four years after that, she became a manager. 
Nicola says this about her job: "My office is at Heathrow Airport, but I spend 60% of my time flying. I teach air hostesses and help them with problems. I also go to many meetings. I usually work from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m., but sometimes I work from 1 p.m. to 9 p.m. 
At work, the first thing I do is check plane times on my computer. Then, I talk to some of the air hostesses. Sometimes, I go on long flights to see how the air hostesses are doing. This is my favorite part of the job, but I like office work too. Traveling can be hard. When I come back from a long trip, I eat something and then go to bed! I don't make a lot of money, but I am happy with British Airways and want to stay there and keep traveling."

'Dear Maria, I am happy to be back home, but I still think about my friends from our English class, especially you. I was sad when I left England because my visit was too short. I want to go back to England, but next time I will stay in a different city. I have started English classes again here. I learned a lot in England, but I know I need to study more. How about you? Are you still looking for a job? I hope you find one soon. Love, Sophie'

'Dear Sir, I lost my bag on a train last week. I was on the 8:30 a.m. train to Cambridge on May 10th. It is a big blue bag, and my name is on it. Did you find my bag? Yours faithfully, Mary Johnson Dear Ms. Johnson, I am happy to tell you that we have your bag. If you come to this office, I can give it to you. The office is open from 9 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. every day. Yours sincerely, J Wilson'

'The Weather People want to know about the weather for many reasons. The weather is important for many jobs. For example, the weather is very important for farmers. A long time ago, farmers watched the sky, animals, and flowers to know about the weather. Now, we use computers to learn about the weather. People can also see the weather on their phones. Today, some people still believe old ideas about the weather. They say if the sky is red in the evening, it will be sunny the next day. Some people also think that when cows lie down in the fields, it will rain soon.'

'A great idea! Frazer and Peter are two 14-year-old boys from a small town in Canada. They are friends and go to the same school. They like to go fishing or swimming on weekends. But for the last few months, they have been in Peter's room working on his computer. They are not doing homework. They made a new computer word game. The idea for the game came from Frazer's little brother, Kevin. Kevin has trouble reading. He learns words better with pictures and sounds. Frazer wanted to help him. Frazer and Peter worked for over 200 hours to make the game. Now it is ready. It is a game with speaking and pictures. For example, if you see the word 'hat', there is a picture of a hat and you hear Peter say 'Hat! Hat!'. The boys have won many prizes for their game. It will soon be sold around the world. Many schools want to buy it.'

'HOW DO THE IRISH POP-GROUP 'BOYZONE' LIVE A HEALTHY LIFE? Sleeping well is very important. When I go to my mother's house, I sleep for ten hours. After a concert, it is hard to sleep because I think about music. Sport is important. Before my car accident, I went to the sports centre for two and a half hours a day, five days a week. Now, I can't do that, so I do about 150 sit-ups a day. I don't drink alcohol or smoke. I try to eat well. I drink a lot of water because it's good for health. I should drink about eight glasses a day, but I don't always do it. People shouldn't work all the time. I love my job, but I like other things too. In my free time, I listen to music or watch TV. It's good to do nothing sometimes. I don't get tired anymore because the doctor told me to eat better. Now, I eat lots of carrots and spinach every day. But I still eat burgers sometimes!'

Bollywood
'Bollywood' is the name of the movie industry in Mumbai, India. Bollywood makes almost 1,000 movies every year. Since 1913, Bollywood has made over 29,000 movies. This is more than the USA, so it is the biggest movie industry in the world. Most people in India like watching movies more than any other activity. Ten million people in India go to the cinema every day. Bollywood movies are about love stories, and they always have singing and dancing. People outside India also like Indian movies. Last year, Bollywood made over $500 million by selling movies to other countries. Indian actors make more movies each year than American actors in Hollywood, but they do not get paid as much. This is why most Bollywood movies only cost about $2 million to make. A Hollywood movie costs at least $5 million. Most Bollywood actors are young. They work hard but only for a few years. Amitabh Bachchan is different. Some people say he is India's greatest actor. He has been in more than 140 movies in almost 40 years.

'Bill Bryson I was born in the United States. I have written many travel books about England. I lived in England with my wife and four children for 20 years. Now, we live in the United States. We have been here for three years. Our children are learning about life in the United States. I think they will be happier because they have lived in two countries. I like Britain and want to go back, but my daughter, Felicity, will start college here soon. So, we will stay for four more years. I just went to England for six weeks. I worked on a radio show about the English language and talked about my new book. Many writers don't like to travel and sell their books. But I like it. I enjoy visiting new places and meeting people. It is very different from my life in the United States when I am writing. In England, people drove me in big cars and I stayed in nice hotels. It was good because I did not have to pay. Everyone was kind to me and it was fun.'

Schnauzer Dogs
There are three sizes of Schnauzer dogs. The two smaller sizes came to England over 50 years ago. The Giant Schnauzer came later. The name "Giant" is good because these dogs are 65 to 67.5 cm tall. All Schnauzers have long hair, which needs to be cut often. Most small Schnauzers are grey, but the Giant Schnauzer is usually black. Schnauzers come from Germany. Farmers use them to help with sheep. The police also use them because Schnauzers are very smart. A Schnauzer is a nice family dog. It is friendly and good with young children.

'The Ruwenzori Mountains Mary Daniels is a student in England. This year, she had a very interesting summer holiday. She traveled with fifteen other people to the Ruwenzori Mountains in Africa. They went there to help make a road through a forest between two big towns. 'It was very difficult because there was no water to drink and no shops where we could buy food,' said Mary. 'It was also very cold and wet in the mountains. It is one of the wettest places in the world.' Mary stayed in the mountains for six weeks. It was hard work, but she says it was the best thing she has ever done. She is hoping to return next year to do some more work there. '

Dear Keira,
Thank you for your letter. Today was my first day at my new school. A girl named Nicole helped me. She showed me the classrooms. She is very nice, and I will visit her this weekend. My favorite lesson today was Maths. I was happy because I knew more than the other girls. I also played hockey for the first time. I liked it a lot. Most of the teachers are friendly, but I am scared of the head teacher. No one likes him because he shouts a lot. I have to go now because I need to do my homework.
Hester

New Books This Month
The Long Night  
This is David Reilly's first book. David was a teacher before he became a writer. Maha is a nurse in northern Australia. She works in a small hospital. One day, a baby is very sick. Maha has to drive all night to take the baby to a big city. They have many problems on the way.
Hard Work  
This is Joanna Jones's twentieth book. Hard Work is about Sombat. Sombat works with his father in Thailand. They make tables and chairs. They work very hard, but they have no money. One day, a man in black buys a beautiful table from them.
Hospital or Cinema?  
Marcie Jacome wrote this story. She studies English in London. Tina is a young woman from Brazil. She wants to be a doctor. She goes to London to study English and medicine. One day, she meets a man. He asks her to go to the USA to be a film star. What will Tina do?

'The history of horse racing Horse racing is a very old sport. It started in Central Asia about 4,500 years ago. People in Greece and Rome also loved horse racing. Modern horse racing began when Arab horses came to Europe in the 12th century. At first, races were long and only had two horses. In the 18th century, races became shorter and had more horses. Today, many people watch horse racing in the USA. It is also popular in other countries.'

Nick Barlow is a British actor. He loves his job. He travels around the world to make TV shows. People are nice to him everywhere he goes. When he comes home, he remembers all the good things from each country. Nick has been to many places, but he wants to visit more. He wants to go to South America and Australia. 
Nick travels with a team. They bring cameras and other things to make the TV show. Nick does not take many clothes, just a few shirts and trousers. But he always takes some books with him. 
Nick's wife is named Helen. She is okay with Nick traveling for work. She has many friends and stays busy. When Nick comes home, she likes to hear his travel stories. Sometimes there are problems. Once, when Nick was in the Malaysian rain forest, Helen was sick in the hospital. Nick felt bad because he could not help her. But Helen did not want him to come home. Nick was very happy when she got better.

Parrots
Maybe you have seen these beautiful birds. They have nice colors and long tails. You can see them in the forest or in the zoo. Parrots live in countries like Brazil, Australia, and India. They like to live in big groups. Parrots eat fruit, so sometimes they are a problem for farmers. There are many kinds of parrots, but all of them have strong beaks and feet. They use these for climbing and holding food. The biggest parrots can live for up to 80 years. Parrots are very noisy, but they are smart birds. You can teach them to talk. Some zoos have parrot shows. You can see parrots doing tricks there.

'HOWARD BONNIER Bray is a pretty village about fifty kilometers west of London. A young man from England named Howard Bonnier opened a restaurant called The Palace there about three and a half months ago. Not many people in Britain know Mr. Bonnier's name yet, but he is already famous in France. This is because he has written in French magazines about many of the best restaurants in France. He is only 29 years old. When Howard was a teenager, he often went to restaurants with his parents. He liked this so much that he decided not to spend money on clothes and CDs; instead, he used his money to visit France and eat in good restaurants. He also bought many French and English cookbooks - he says he has more than two hundred and fifty! Why did he open a restaurant? Because he loves cooking. Was it easy? He says it is expensive to start your own restaurant and it is much harder to cook for fifty people than for your family, but he is sure he made the right choice.'

John Pickering
John Pickering works in a park in a small town in England. He cuts the grass and waters the flowers. Last week, he was in Tokyo, Japan. Many people in Japan watched him on TV because he is a famous singer there. John went to Japan a few months ago to sing in clubs. A radio DJ heard his songs and played them on the radio. Many young people liked his songs and called the radio to hear them again. 
In Japan, John uses the name Jon Otis when he sings. But he will keep working in the park in England. He does not know how much money he will make from singing. He says, 'I need to keep my job in the park because I have to pay my bills!' The other gardeners do not know he is famous in Japan. They have never heard him sing. 
John's wife, Denise, works in a hospital. She says, 'This will not change our life. I only know John Pickering, not Jon Otis!'

Line Dancing
Many people in Britain have a new hobby called line dancing. In almost every town, there are clubs and classes for this activity. Line dancing is easy to learn. Fiona Lever, a teacher, says, "If you can walk, you can do it!" You don't need a partner because you dance in groups. It's a great way to make new friends. In my classes, there are young and old people. Boys like it because they can make a lot of noise with their feet during the dances!
When did line dancing start? Most people think it began about fifteen years ago when American country music became popular in Britain.

'The Rhino There are five kinds of rhinos in the world. The Black and White Rhinos live in Africa. The other rhinos live in Asia. All rhinos have big, heavy bodies. Their skin is very hard and they have little hair. Rhinos have four short legs. Each foot has three toes. They walk slowly, but they can run fast, up to 50 kilometers an hour. Rhinos are usually quiet and calm. They eat grass and plants. A baby rhino weighs 40 kilos when it is born. It stays inside its mother for about fifteen months. An adult rhino weighs over 200 kilos and can live to be 50 years old.'

**THE HISTORY OF THE LONDON POLICE**
Today, there are police everywhere. But in 1700, London had no police. Only a few old men watched the streets at night, and they did not get much money. 
About 300 years ago, London started to grow. The city was very dirty, and many people were poor. There were many thieves who took money in the streets. People stayed at home because of this.
In 1750, Henry Fielding paid some people to stop the thieves. They were like police and were called 'Bow Street Runners' because they worked near Bow Street. 
Fifty years later, there were 120 Bow Street Runners. But London was very big and needed more police. So, in 1829, the first London Police Force started with 3000 officers. Most of them walked, but some rode horses.
Until 1920, all the police in London were men. Today, London police get good pay. Police who ride horses get even better pay.

'TO ALL STUDENTS: Do you want to go on a camping trip this weekend? We will go to the forest in the school bus. We will stay at a camp-site from Friday to Sunday. The camp-site has hot showers and a small shop. You can rent bicycles there. The trip costs Â£25. It is very cold at night, so bring warm clothes and wear strong shoes. If you want to come, tell me today. Ahmed, Student Secretary'

'Visit the Edinburgh Festival! Every year, many people come to Edinburgh, the capital city of Scotland, for the Edinburgh Festival. For three weeks in August and September, the city is full of actors and artists from around the world. They come for the biggest arts festival in Britain. During this time, the streets have music and dance from morning until night. You can even see artists painting on the streets. One fun part of the Festival is the 'Fringe', where students do comedy shows in small places. Many tourists come to see new films, plays, and hear music by famous musicians. This year, you can see over five hundred shows with actors from more than forty countries. The tickets are not expensive, and it is often easier to see your favorite star in Edinburgh than in London. So come to Edinburgh next summer, but remember it can be hard to find a room, so book your hotel now!'

ICE-FISHING
If you drive north from Toronto for three hours, you will find Lake Nipissing. In winter, the lake turns to ice. Every weekend, many Canadian fishermen go there. They build small wooden houses on the ice and paint them in bright colors. They sit inside to catch fish that swim under the ice.
Bob Marvisch has come here every year for twenty-five years. He says, "You need clothes that are light but warm: two pairs of socks and gloves, some thin sweaters, and a snow suit on top. Catching fish is easy. First, you break the ice and make a small round hole. Next, you take a fishing line and put some bread on it. Then, you put the line through the hole into the water. You pull the line up when the fish eat the bread. The fish are between ten and twenty centimeters long. Some people like to eat them, but when I catch three or four fish, I like to have some chocolate or another snack! Today I caught twenty-five! It's a fun sport, and you can meet nice people here!"

From: Greg  
To: Anna  
Hi Anna,  
I'm not having a good week! Yesterday, my team played a volleyball match, but we lost. The other team played better than us. Then, my friend Jeff, who lives in Australia, called me with bad news. He can't come to stay with us during the holidays because he has a summer job. We can't go camping together now. This morning, my sister got up late and took my bike to school! She didn't tell me she needed it. I'm really angry with her. I hope you have some good news! Write back today if you can.  
Greg

'Madame Tussaud's
Madame Tussaud's museum is a very famous place for tourists in London. In this museum, people can see wax figures of famous people. Madame Tussaud was born in France in 1761. Her uncle was a doctor, and he made wax figures of people. He opened a museum in Paris with these figures. Marie helped her uncle with his work. In 1789, during the French Revolution, Marie went to prison. In prison, she had to make wax copies of the heads of famous people who had died, like Queen Marie Antoinette. In 1795, Marie married Francois Tussaud. In 1802, she came to London with her wax figures. She opened a museum in London, and people can still see her wax figures there today.'

'BICYCLES A bicycle is a cheap and clean way to travel. The first bicycle was made about 150 years ago. At first, bicycles were expensive. Only rich people could buy them. These early bicycles looked very different from the ones we have now. Later, bicycles became cheaper, and many people bought them. People started riding bicycles to work and in their free time. Today, people use cars more than bicycles because cars are faster and you don't get wet when it rains. But some people still like to ride bicycles to work. They say there are too many cars in town centers and it is hard to find a place to park.'

'The Elephant Show by Daniel Allsop, age 14 Last summer, I went to Thailand for a beach holiday with my family. One day, we visited a park near our hotel. The park had pretty flower gardens, but we wanted to see the elephant show. We went to a big area with seats on three sides. Three elephants came in with their keepers and stood in front of big white cards. Each elephant got a paintbrush and started to paint on its card. Sometimes, the keepers gave the elephants new brushes with paint and took the old ones away. Slowly, the elephants painted pictures on the cards, following their keepers' instructions. I was amazed! One picture showed a river, another a tree, and the third a bunch of flowers. When the keepers showed the paintings, everyone wanted to buy one. We gave the elephants the bananas we brought for our lunch. Twenty years ago, elephants worked in the forest. Now, they do not work there, but the smartest elephants live in special places where visitors can watch them.'

'Big cats There are many kinds of big cats. They are different in size and how they look and act. Tigers are the biggest cats. From head to tail, they can be 3.7 meters long. Most cats don't like water, but tigers like to lie in water when it is hot! Lions are the only cats that live in big family groups. Many lions work together to get food for the group. They usually live in flat, open places where they can see far and follow other animals easily. All cats need good eyes because they catch smaller animals for food. They also need to be fast and very strong.'

Dear Mrs. Brian,
I am sorry, but I can't come to your class anymore. I have to go back to my country. My sister will get married next month. I want to go shopping with her to choose a dress. My parents will make a big meal for the guests, and there will be a lot of work in the kitchen. I am sorry I have to leave the English class. You are a very good teacher. Please say goodbye to the other students for me. Thank you again.
Best wishes,  
Soraya

Dear Lorna,
How are you? I am happy because I have a new job in the city center. I work in a Tourist Information Office. It is very interesting. I start work every morning at 7:30, so I get up very early! I love this job because I meet people from many different countries. I like telling them about our city. Here is a photo of me. I am wearing my new uniform. Do you like it?
Love,  
Gloria

'THE OSTRICH The ostrich is the biggest bird in the world. An adult ostrich can weigh more than 90 kilos. Most wild ostriches live in southern Africa, but there are not many left. Ostriches have wings, but they cannot fly. They use their wings to help them turn when they run. Ostriches can run very fast, from 65 to 90 kilometers an hour. This makes it hard for other animals to catch them. Baby ostriches are the same size as chickens. They take about 3 years to grow up. Ostriches eat plants and can live for many days without water.'

Victoria Jamieson is from Britain. She started snowboarding when she was 20 years old. Now, she is 23 and has won many snowboarding competitions. We talked to her last week in Switzerland at a snowboarding competition. We asked her why she started snowboarding. She said, "I like all sports, especially skiing, so snowboarding was a natural choice. It is easy to learn, and you can get good in a few months."
We asked if she practices a lot. She said, "In winter, I snowboard every day in the mountains from 8:30 a.m. to 4 p.m. I also run and bike. I love doing all these activities! I enjoy competitions and being in the mountains because they are beautiful. But I love free-riding the most. Free-riding is snowboarding for fun, not in a competition."
We asked her what is important when learning snowboarding. She said, "You can learn fast, but you need lessons. It is also important to have the right clothes so you don't get wet because you fall down a lot at first!"

'23 Oak Avenue Manchester Hello, I want a room at your hotel for three nights from September 15th to 17th. I want a single room with a shower. I also need a phone in my room. Can I have a quiet room on the ground floor, please? I will drive to the hotel. Is there a car park at the hotel? I will arrive at about 10:30 p.m. What time does the restaurant close in the evening? If possible, I would like to eat when I arrive. Thank you for your help. Best regards, Mark Jones'

Mount Kilimanjaro
Mount Kilimanjaro is the tallest mountain in Africa. Many people have climbed it, from a seven-year-old boy to an 87-year-old man. There are different paths to reach the top. People say the Marangu path, which is five kilometers long, is the easiest. It takes about five days to climb and is very popular with tourists. Only half of the people who try to climb Kilimanjaro reach the top. This is often because the weather can change quickly. At the start, it can be hot and wet, but at the top, there is ice and snow, and it can be very cold, below 20 degrees. Climbers need to bring both sunglasses and warm clothes!

'Otters Not many people have seen an otter. Otters are animals that live near rivers. They make their homes from small pieces of wood. Otters usually come out at night. They are very good at swimming and can swim more than 10 kilometers an hour. Otters have thick brown hair to keep them warm in the water. They can close their ears and nose, so they can stay underwater for a few minutes. Twenty years ago, there were not many otters in Great Britain. The rivers were dirty, and many fish and insects died. The otters had no food. But now, the rivers are clean again, and there is lots of food for otters.'

'Dear Deshini, I am happy you are my new penfriend. My name is Tom. I am 15 years old. I was born in Canada, but now I live in England. Please write to me about your life in India. I want to visit India one day. Do you live in a small village or a big town? What is your school like? Do you have any pictures of your school? Can you send them to me? I am sending you some photos of my family. I will send more next time. I hope you write to me soon. Tom'

'17 Green Street Camden London 29th August 2002 Dear John, Thank you for helping me with my English. You are a very good teacher. I liked my time in Cambridge. Now I am at my brother's flat. He is learning to be a doctor. I will stay with him for two weeks and then go home to Greece. I like London a lot. We went to Regents Park by bus yesterday. It was very sunny and we had a good time. Tonight, I will see a film with my brother and his friends. I will write again from Greece. Best wishes, Kostas'
